briefTitle: Compare Ceftazidime-Avibactam + Metronidazole Versus Meropenem for Hospitalized Adults With Complicated Intra-Abdominal Infections
officialTitle: A Phase III, Randomized, Multicenter, Double Blind, Double-Dummy, Parallel-Group, Comparative Study to Determine the Efficacy, Safety, and Tolerability of Ceftazidime Avibactam Plus Metronidazole Versus Meropenem in the Treatment of Complicated Intra-Abdominal Infections In Hospitalized Adults
summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of Ceftazidime Avibactam plus Metronidazole compared to Meropenem for treating hospitalized patients with complicated intra-abdominal infections.

primaryOutcome.measure: Clinical Response at the Test of Cure (TOC) Visit in the Microbiologically Modified Intent-To-Treat (mMITT) Analysis Set (Primary Outcome for FDA).
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: TOC: 28 to 35 days after start of study drug
